price: (49) Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."[1237]
arabic: قُلۡ جَآءَ ٱلۡحَقُّ وَمَا يُبۡدِئُ ٱلۡبَٰطِلُ وَمَا يُعِيدُ
footnotes: [1237]- This expression alludes to complete inability, meaning that falsehood was abolished.

version.title: English Translation - Saheeh International
version.description: Translation of the Quran meanings into English - Saheeh International - Al-Muntada Al-Islami (Islamic Forum)

meta.transliteration: qul jāa al-ḥaqu wamā yub'di-u al-bāṭilu wamā yuʿīdu
